===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ぬ|yomi=k}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|-|sort=ぬ}}. Root of the {{cog|ojp|-}} verb {{m|ja|ぬる|tr=nuru|t=to become loose; to become wet}} and modern {{cog|ja|濡れる|tr=nureru|t=to become wet}}, adverb {{m|ja|ぬるぬる|tr=nurunuru|t=loosely; lukewarmly; oozingly}}.

May be cognate with {{cog|ko|늪|t=swamp, bog, marsh}}, {{cog|mn|нам|t=low-lying}}, {{m|mn|намаг|t=swamp, bog, marsh}}, {{m|mn|норох|t=to become wet}}.

Generally only used in compounds in modern {{cog|ja|-}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=k|ぬ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぬ}}

# a [[swamp]], a [[bog]], a [[marsh]], a [[wetland]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|小沼|おぬ}}: a [[swamp]], particularly a [[small]] one
* {{ja-r|隠沼|こもりぬ}}: a [[hidden]] [[bog]]

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|沼間|^ぬま}}: a [[surname]]

</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|ぬま|yomi=k}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|しょう|yomi=o}}
{{IPAchar|/seu/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕeu/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕʲoː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=しよう|沼|tr=tsyew<sup>X</sup>||swamp}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|沼|tr=zhǎo}}.

Only ever used in compounds.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|しょう}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|しょう|hhira=せう}}

# a [[swamp]], a [[bog]], a [[marsh]], a [[wetland]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}

* {{ja-r|沼湖|しょうこ}}: [[marsh]]es and [[lake]]s
* {{ja-r|沼沢|しょうたく}}: [[marsh]]es and [[bog]]s
* {{ja-r|沼地|しょうち}}: [[clabber]], [[marshy]] [[soil]], marshy [[ground]]; a [[swampy]] [[place]]
* {{ja-r|沼池|しょうち}}: [[marsh]]es and [[pond]]s
* {{ja-r|沼鉄鉱|しょうてっこう}}: [[bog iron]]
{{der-mid}}
